column4: hey hey i am a noob with linux and need a hand with an install on a wireless usb device
this is probably my last post for today, but do an lspci in an terminal an look for the wireless chip. People are more helpful in matters that they peronally have experienced.
and if it is an 27*xx or a 28*xx chip from ralink you must blacklist the other driver to get it to work.
